page.title: 05BENWELL NATURE PARK
page.content: In the mid 1970's terraces of{Tyneside {flats}were demolished because they were old and unsuitable for living in. Tyneside flats were built for two families and had a front door and a backdoor. The council could not build new houses on the site because it was on a very steep slope and there were old mine workings in the area. A member of the council visited London to look at the{William Curtis} Ecolgical Park. He came back to Newcastle and persuaded the council to set up a{nature park}in Benwell.In 1982 the work began with tractors and excavators reshaping the land and creating a large pond in the centre of the site.Children came from all over Newcastle to plant trees and shrubs.The pond has attracted tadpoles, frogs and newts. { }
